body.name: SAMSUNG 32" M80C UHD HDR Smart Computer Monitor Screen with Streaming TV, Slimfit Camera Included, Wireless Remote PC Access, Alexa Built-in (LS32CM80GUNXZA), Spring Green
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 16 hrs
FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 16 hrs
features: SMART TV EXPERIENCE: Enjoy Netflix, YouTube and other streaming services by simply connecting the monitor to WiFi; Samsung TV Plus also offers free live and on-demand content with no downloads or sign-up needed, while Universal Guide provides personalized content recommendations.Viewing Angle:178.0 degrees.Response time:4.0 milliseconds

ICONIC SLIM DESIGN: The Smart Monitor is built with your lifestyle in mind, delivering a more cutting-edge design than ever; With an ultra-slim flat back, neat camera design and beautiful colors, the monitor offers a minimalist look that suits any environment and enhances your setup with super style

PC-LESS PRODUCTIVITY: Browse the web, edit documents and work on projects, all without the need for a separate PC; With new Workmode, you can also remotely access another PC, use Microsoft Office 365 programs and even connect to Samsung mobile devices with Samsung DeX for seamless working

IoT HUB: Turn your Smart Monitor into a control center for the home by connecting it to your IoT home products with SmartThings; Relax by turning off the lights, pulling down the blinds and setting the thermostat to the perfect temperature all with the Smart Monitor for a perfectly relaxed evening
body.description: The M80C Smart Monitor with embedded TV apps allows you to experience smarter entertainment. It’s the ultimate hub for gaming, entertainment, and productivity, all on one monitor. Connect to loved ones, colleagues, and even health professionals, via the SlimFit Camera. Plus, an ergonomic, slim design provides workspace utility and style.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Laughable speakers but otherwise OK
reviews.reviewText: As others pointed out in their reviews, the built-in speakers are garbage. And Samsung doesn’t even provide an 3.5mm aux, which is baffling. Have not dove into Bluetooth speakers yet, but it’s disappointing this is the only option. If you’re expecting to use this as a TV and a computer monitor, factor in the cost of decent speakers.Otherwise, the smartOS is fine. Build quality seems decent, but the screen quality is ‘meh. Not great when viewing at an angle. Honestly, it’s passable for basic computer use and as a secondary TV. Wouldn’t rely on it for everyday streaming. It’s a compromise worth the package to meet a dual purpose need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Pretty display, pretty terrible otherwise
reviews.reviewText: Problematic with laptops using USB-C docks, often takes 1/2 hour or more to get the display to work with a device. Awful experience. Also, requires a special cable (DP mini to whatever your output is)Very problematic if more than one is in the same location, can only be powered on via a remote, and regardless of where it is pointed...all devices will be controlled. So if one needs to get turned on..it is a safe bet all the other ones will turn off. Have to point the remote down a paper towel roll to manage a single unit. Awful experience.The webcam does NOT work in Windows unless you snake a different USB-C cable to it, when connected as Samsung intended, it only works through the built in OS, which is also quite crap. Awful design. So...my opinion as an IT tech...if you are looking for something that doubles as a TV and a monitor, this is a fair choice. If intent is to use as a PC/laptop display....run in the opposite direction. Awful choice.
